::KitKat::

She sighed, "Because I gave you my word. I am also curious as to why 
you broke in here. I have no reason to let you live. But I gave you 
my word that I would not harm you. And I swore that no harm would 
come to you."

She no longer really wanted this bot. For anything. She only wanted 
him to leave. She didn't see him as a threat. If anything, she hoped 
that she might gain him as an ally.

"You intrieg me Fox. You came here, stole stuff from my lab. You 
obviously had a reason, and I wish to know that reason. I will not 
harm you. Once you have ansered my questions," she looked down, 
knowing she would live to regret this,"I will let you go. No harm, no 
fight. Just answer my questions and you are free. You have my word, 
my honor."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> Foxfingers transformed back to bot mode and stayed crouched behind 
> the engines. He pulled out a detonator knowing that a Preds 
greatest 
> weakness was self preservation. "I have a detonator over here, 
whats 
> to keep me from blowing this whole place to little pieces?" he held 
> it out in the open for her to see. He wasn't lieing, he had a 
> detonator, he just didn't have the explosives to back it up. It was 
a 
> gamble but he was quickly running out of options. His bag of tricks 
> was running low too. 
> 
> KitKat wanted him alive he wanted to know why. "Whats so important 
> about me that you'd let me live?" he asked directly. There was no 
> longer any avoiding the issues there were only questions and 
answers.
>
